intro: Agrostophyllum patentissimum, commonly known as the broad-leaved agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
